snippet: “Daisies” ran afoul of the Communist government in 1960s Czechoslovakia, but now the film, screening at BAMcinématek, is a classic of that country’s New Wave.
abstract: Daisies, a 1966 classic Czech New Wave film by Vera Chytilova that was banned by the Communist government, is now screening at the Brooklyn Academy of Music.
lead_paragraph: “Daisies” ran afoul of the Communist government in 1960s Czechoslovakia, but now the film, screening at BAMcinématek, is a classic of that country’s New Wave.

headline.seo: ‘Daisies,’ From the Czech Director Vera Chytilova, at BAM
headline.main: An Audience for Free Spirits in a Closed Society
headline.print_headline: An Audience For Free Spirits In a Closed Society
